intro: Ribes nigrum var. nigrum, commonly known as blackcurrant, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It produces small, dark purple to black berries that are rich in antioxidants and vitamin C. The plant has alternate, simple, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a distinctive red or purple stem. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The flowers are clustered in racemes and are usually pink or white, appearing before the leaves in early spring.
